item.title: How 3D Printing is Transforming Manufacturing Sites
item.description: 3DPrinting Introduction Over the past few years, 3D printing has evolved from a futuristic concept to an accessible, everyday tool. What was once confined to research labs is now widely available, with cutting-edge printers costing less than Â£1,000 and software so intuitive that anyone with a computer and a mouse can use it.

item.title: Debezium
item.description: Debezium is a Kafka Connect connector that uses database Change Data Capture (CDC) logs to detect changes to SQL tables in real time and stream changes up to a Kafka instance. ...

item.title: Kafka Connect
item.description: Kafka connect is a tool that allows deployment of connectors to interface different systems with a Kafka Message Broker. For example Debezium could be used to replicate shop floor databases in real time into Kafka to be consumed.

item.title: Kafka
item.description: Kafka is a PubSub platform used to stream high volumes of data using Topics. Kafka is designed to be fault tolerant and scalable through the use of a platform like Kubernetes.

item.title: Message Broker
item.description: A message broker is an application that stores messages in some form of memory, typically a Queue, from data senders and allows reading of those messages from data readers ...

item.title: Continuous Process Verification
item.description: Continuous Process Verification (CPV), is a process required in pharmaceutical manufacturing to monitor all Critical Quality Attributes, Critical Process Parameters and Critical ...

item.title: Control Module
item.description: A Process cell is an ISA88 defined structure that belongs to a Equipment Module and is the lowest level defined in the physical hierarchy. Control Modules are typically instruments such as valves or pressure sensors.

item.title: Critical Material Attribute
item.description: A Critical Material Attribute (CMA), is an attribute of raw material supplied to a pharmaceutical Manufacturing process that effects the quality of product produced, for example ...

item.title: Critical Process Parameter
item.description: A Critical Process Parameter (or CPP) is a parameter of a manufacturing process that has a direct impact on a Critical Quality Attribute of a product such as pressure over a filter, ...

item.title: Critical Quality Attribute
item.description: A Critical Quality Attribute (or CQA) is an attribute chosen for a product that ensures that it is of the desired quality. For example a product could have a CQA for the pH, Particle size, endotoxin content, sterility etc.
